intro: Lewisia columbiana subsp. rupicola, commonly known as the rock lewisia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, grass-like leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its horticultural value lies in its ornamental flowers and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
